title: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: Definitely no chocolate at Anthea's third wedding
text:
Anthea Turner never lived down inviting Cadbury’s to sponsor her wedding to businessman Grant Bovey in a reputed £300,000 deal that involved posing for a cheesy picture of the happy couple biting into a chocolate bar.

So the TV presenter can be forgiven for wanting her next wedding to be a much more intimate affair.

‘We’ll probably just run off and text everyone once we’ve done it,’ says former Blue Peter host Anthea, who’s engaged to socialite Mark Armstrong.

Anthea Turner is engaged to socialite Mark Armstrong (pictured left) and says she is 'not scared' to walk up the aisle for the third time

Her first marriage was to DJ Peter Powell. Speaking at the Frieze opening party at the Groucho club in Soho, London, she tells me: ‘I’m not scared of walking up the aisle for a third time. I’m 60 next year and so loved-up. It’s my second spring in life.’

Oh, to be a fly on the wall when Boris Johnson comes face to face with the Queen next week. I hear the Prime Minister is due to be summoned to Buckingham Palace for his first meeting with Her Majesty since he sent Jacob Rees-Mogg to Balmoral to seek permission for Parliament to be prorogued. Boris made a grovelling telephone call to the Queen after the Supreme Court ruled that the suspension unlawful.

‘The Prime Minister will have an audience with the Queen soon after she comes back from Scotland,’ a courtier tells me.

My advice to Boris: tin hat on.

Tory MP Sir Geoffrey Clifton-Brown was thrown out his party's conference this week

Shame-faced Tory MP Sir Geoffrey Clifton-Brown, who was thrown out of his party’s conference in Manchester this week over a clash with security staff, has found an elegant figure to provide consolation.

I can disclose that he has become engaged to Kym Erlich, a fun-loving actress-turned-estate agent many years his junior. ‘They are very loved-up,’ one of their friends tells me.

The divorced Cotswolds MP, 66, is said to be living with Kym, whose exes include former MP and spy writer Rupert Allason, banking scion Alex Hoare and journalist William Cash, at his pile near Cirencester and his swish pad in Central London.

(Very) modern manners

It may have become de rigueur to wear your cosiest togs while flying, but flamboyant television presenter Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen is determined to make air travel chic again.

‘I would never be caught dead wearing a pair of tracksuit bottoms on a flight,’ the interior designer declares at the London launch of a project to rebuild Teatro San Cassiano in Venice. ‘I’m forever being teased by my family for what I wear while I’m travelling.

Flamboyant television presenter Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen (pictured) said he 'would never be caught dead wearing a pair of tracksuit bottoms'

‘But I think you should enjoy it and feel comfortable and slightly in control.’

Llewelyn-Bowen, who has worked at Buckingham Palace, adds: ‘To suddenly become a toddler and put on a romper suit because you’re on a plane — I don’t really understand that.’
description: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: Anthea Turner is 'not scared' to walk down the aisle for the third time after recently announcing engagement to socialite Mark Armstrong. Says she is 'so loved up'.
authors: Richard Eden For The Daily Mail
